title: Shehbaz Sharif, AKD hold discussion
byline: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif expressed his deepest sorrow over the tragic loss of life and property caused by Cyclone Ditwah in Sri Lanka.

title: Take steps to release vehicles stuck at Customs: Harsha
byline: Chairman of the Committee on Public Finance (COPF) MP Harsha de Silva today requested the government to make arrangements to take steps towards releasing around 900 imported vehicles that are stuck in the port at the moment.

title: Civil Aviation urges drone operators to avoid emergency zones
byline: The Director General of Civil Aviation has advised all drone operators, both commercial and recreational, to refrain from flying drones in areas where helicopter operations are underway. This warning comes amid ongoing search, rescue, and relief operations in regions affected by recent disasters.

title: Death toll from adverse weather rises to 465
byline: The death toll in the aftermath of Cyclone Ditwah that ravaged the country last week has risen to 465, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) revealed in its update this morning.

title: Parliament observes one minute silence to respect disaster victims
byline: Parliament observed one minute’s silence in remembrance of all those who lost their lives due to the disaster situation in the country.

title: President convenes urgent Cabinet meeting
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has convened an urgent meeting of the Cabinet of Ministers this afternoon, the Government Information Department said.

title: COPF needs proper support of Parliament: Harsha
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (COPF) needs the support of Parliament to resolve certain issues, its Chairman Harsha de Silva told Parliament today.

title: 22 districts declared national disaster zones
byline: A special gazette has been issued declaring 22 districts severely affected by Cyclone Ditwah as national disaster areas.

title: Drone aid mission brings relief to stranded residents in Wellampitiya
byline: The situation in the Wellampitiya area on Monday, where rising floodwaters, blocked roads and left residents stranded, motivated four citizens and a drone operations company to step up to the challenge and deliver dry rations to residents in need.

title: Govt. must have a ’’Multi-Phased Action Plan’’ for Sri Lanka’s Flood Crisis and Recovery
byline: Sri Lanka is currently grappling with one of the most severe flooding events in recent memory. With vast tracts of land submerged, lives lost, and critical infrastructure severely damaged, the immediate humanitarian crisis is escalating. The transition from emergency response to systematic recovery and reconstruction must be swift, strategic, and sustainable.

title: Kaduwela–Battaramulla Road reopened
byline: The Kaduwela–Battaramulla road, which was temporarily closed due to flooding, has been reopened to traffic from this morning, police said.

title: Apple to support relief efforts in flood-hit Sri Lanka
byline: Apple CEO Tim Cook has announced that the company will contribute to relief and rebuilding efforts across several Asian countries—including Sri Lanka—following days of severe flooding, landslides, and powerful winds.

title: CBSL assures SL’s economic ‘shock absorbers’ intact
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) is ready to deploy its full suite of macroeconomic shields, fiscal, monetary and external, to cushion the economy against sudden shocks, Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe said.

title: ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund must get Parliament approval: Harsha
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) MP Harsha de Silva said today that a fund called ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ cannot be established without Parliamentary approval and urged the government to get it approved by Parliament.

title: WHO allocates US$175,000 to strengthen health response in flood-hit Sri Lanka
byline: The World Health Organization (WHO) has allocated US$175,000 in emergency funds to support critical health services for communities affected by severe flooding and landslides across all 25 districts of Sri Lanka.

title: Police told to act against those insulting President, Ministers
byline: Deputy Minister Sunil Watagala has directed the police to invoke emergency regulations to take action against individuals carrying out defamatory social media campaigns targeting the President and several government Ministers.

title: More Indian troops arrive in Sri Lanka to assist flood relief effort
byline: The Indian Army has deployed a specialized contingent to Sri Lanka under Operation Sagar Bandhu to assist communities affected by severe flooding caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Kaduwela, Athurugiriya interchanges reopen
byline: The Kaduwela interchange entrance and exit, along with the Athurugiriya entrance and exit of the expressway which were temporarily closed due to the prevailing flood situation, have been reopened for normal traffic from today.

title: Affected school children to get Rs. 25,000
byline: The President’s Fund will grant Rs. 25,000  for the educational needs of every school-going child affected by floods and landslides, President’s Media Division said.

title: Declare day of mourning for disaster victims: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today urged the government to declare a day of mourning for the disaster victims.

title: Court issues warrants for Wimal Weerawansa
byline: Warrants have been issued for former MP Wimal Weerawansa by the Fort Magistrate’s Court after he failed to appear in connection with a pending case.

title: Cancel IMF agreement, talk to Trump, bring in new budget: Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa today called for a new programme to rebuild the nation after the recent disaster and therefore cancel the IMF agreement and go for a fresh agreement.

title: Search for long-missing Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 to resume
byline: The search for the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines flight MH370 will resume on 30 December, over a decade after the aircraft with 239 people on board vanished, Malaysian authorities have said.

title: UN ready to support relief, response efforts: UN Secretary General
byline: The United Nations (UN) stands ready to support relief and response efforts in Sri Lanka, Secretary General of the United Nations António Guterres said.

title: Pakistan sends elite search and rescue team to Sri Lanka
byline: In response to the large-scale destruction caused by the severe storm in Sri Lanka and following a request for assistance from the Sri Lankan government, Pakistan has intensified relief efforts for the affected population.

title: Central Bank not under my purview during bond scam: Ravi K
byline: Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya has made a false statement that the Central Bank was under his purview during his tenure as Finance Minister in 2015, MP Ravi Karunanayake told Parliament today.

title: Ali Sabry calls for Climate Change University in Sri Lanka
byline: Former Minister Ali Sabry has reiterated the importance of establishing a Climate Change University in Sri Lanka, noting that the idea, once dismissed by opposition parties, is now more crucial than ever.

title: Sri Lanka welcomes over 2,000 tourists aboard Mein Schiff 06
byline: Describing it as a “powerful symbol of resilience and recovery,” the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) today welcomed more than 2,000 international passengers aboard the luxury cruise ship Mein Schiff 06.

title: Bangladesh delivers urgent aid to Sri Lanka
byline: Bangladesh dispatched a humanitarian relief consignment to Sri Lanka this afternoon (03 December) to support ongoing recovery efforts following the devastation caused by the recent adverse weather conditions.

title: UAE sends new relief shipment to Sri Lanka
byline: The United Arab Emirates (UAE) has dispatched another consignment of humanitarian relief to Sri Lanka, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said today.

title: Over 20,000 blood donations received following Ditwah
byline: The National Blood Bank expressed its gratitude to the citizens of Sri Lanka for their overwhelming response to calls for blood donations following Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Public urged to take precautions as post-flood diseases surge
byline: Health officials have raised concerns over a rise in leptospirosis (rat fever), diarrhoea, chikungunya, dengue and various skin infections in the aftermath of recent floods across several parts of Sri Lanka.

title: Nearly 70 countries pledge humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka: Minister
byline: Nearly seventy countries have already offered to provide humanitarian aid to Sri Lanka in the wake of the disaster situation in the country, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Anura Karunathilake said today.

title: Court dismisses Reuters’s writ petition; Orders to pay Rs. 100,000 in exemplary costs to Sri Lankan journalist
byline: The Court of Appeal yesterday dismissed a writ petition filed by Refinitiv Limited, formerly Reuters, challenging a decision by the Labour Commissioner directing the company to pay Rs. 6,217,146 in arrears of EPF and surcharges to Sri Lankan journalist and former Reuters correspondent, Ranga Sirilal.

title: November records 2.1 mn tourists
byline: The month of November has recorded around 2.1 million tourists for the year so far.

title: Fourth U.S. Coast Guard cutter transferred to Sri Lanka
byline: A fourth U.S. Coast Guard cutter is being transferred to the Sri Lanka Navy, US Ambassador to Sri Lanka Julie Chung said today.

title: Appoint Parliamentary Select Committee to probe allegations of failure to prevent disaster: Namal
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) MP Namal Rajapaksa today urged the Speaker to appoint a Parliamentary Select Committee to investigate into the allegations of the failure to prevent the devastation caused by the adverse weather in the country.

title: Stop promoting infant formula, promote breastfeeding only
byline: The Health Ministry has urged mothers not to feed infants with powdered milk, bottled milk or any forms of supplementary food, despite the challenging conditions created by the recent adverse weather.

title: SLAF has only four helicopters: Deputy Minister
byline: The Sri Lankan Air Force (SLAF) had only four helicopters for use during the recent disaster, Deputy Minister of Defence Aruna Jayasekera told Parliament today.

title: Airbus to inspect some planes over ’quality issue’ with panels
byline: Airbus has confirmed an unspecified number of its aircraft will undergo inspections after a ’’supplier quality issue’’ with metal panels used on some A320 planes was identified.

title: Navy divers repair flood-damaged water plants
byline: In the aftermath of severe weather, the Sri Lanka Navy has launched a comprehensive, island-wide Humanitarian Assistance and Disaster Relief (HADR) programme to deliver essential services to affected communities.

title: Serena Williams says no comeback, despite filing paperwork
byline: Serena Williams has filed the necessary paperwork for a return to tennis - but then said she is ’’not coming back’’ to the sport.

title: Convene national level meeting: Opposition parties
byline: Around 35 Opposition political parties which met former President Ranil Wickremesinghe today, urged the government to convene a national level meeting of  political, religious and other civil leaders to discuss the current disaster situation.

title: Ravi responds to Prime Minister over Treasury Bond issue
byline: Former Minister of Finance and current Member of Parliament, Ravi Karunanayake, today moved to correct what he described as misleading statements made by the Prime Minister in Parliament regarding the 2015 Treasury Bond issue.

title: SC reopens case on foreign broker’s eligibility for NITF tender
byline: A legal fight over whether an international broker can take part in Sri Lanka’s reinsurance procurement has taken a fresh turn after the Supreme Court cleared the path for the District Court to decide the matter independently.

title: One injured in Kosgama shooting
byline: A 40-year-old man travelling in a three-wheeler was injured in a shooting incident in the Boralugoda area in Kosgama this evening (03). He was rushed to the Avissawella Hospital for treatment.

title: Police launch probe into 57 fake social media posts
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an investigation under emergency regulations after police identified 57 social media posts containing fake news, disinformation, rumours, and unverified updates that have circulated in recent days.

title: Make Christmas deeply spiritual through love and concern for those in needy: Cardinal
byline: Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith today urged all Catholics in the Archdiocese and in Sri Lanka to make this year’s Christmas deeply spiritual through concern for the needy and those who have been affected by the recent disaster.

title: 38 fuel stations damaged due to floods: Minister
byline: Some 38 fuel stations have been damaged due to the flood situation in the country, Energy Minister Kumara Jayakody said today.

title: YouTube says it will comply with Australia’s teen social media ban
byline: Google’s YouTube shared a ’’disappointing update’’ to millions of Australian users and content creators on Wednesday, saying it will comply with a world-first teen social media ban by locking out users aged under 16 from their accounts within days.

title: Adverse weather: Death toll climbs to 479
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported that the death toll from the ongoing adverse weather conditions across Sri Lanka has risen to 479, with 350 people still reported missing as at 4.00 pm today.

title: Commuters will be allowed to use train tickets to travel by bus: Minister
byline: Commuters will be allowed to use train tickets to travel by busses on a temporary basis, Minister of Transport Bimal Ratnayake told Parliament today.

title: US provides $2 million emergency life-saving assistance to Sri Lanka
byline: In response to the severe impact of Tropical Cyclone Ditwah, the United States is providing $2 million in emergency life-saving assistance for people in need in Sri Lanka, the office of the spokesman said.

title: Capital goods lead turnover as market indices decline
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange witnessed subdued sentiment today, even as the Capital Goods sector dominated overall activity by contributing 39% of total turnover and generating LKR 1.46 billion. AEL.N emerged as the day’s top contributor, recording LKR 282 million in turnover with 3.9 million shares changing hands.

title: SJB to take action against Kandy Councillors for blocking relief efforts
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said that the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) will take strict disciplinary action against members of the Kandy Municipal Council who reportedly obstructed relief efforts by volunteers in the district.
